alert.note: Alert for Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Eastern Box Elder County; Great Salt Lake Desert and Mountains; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:01PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cache and northeastern Box Elder Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 400 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout 15 miles northeast of Great Salt Lake North of the Causeway, or 21 miles southwest of Tremonton, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tremonton, Clarkston, Plymouth, Howell, Riverside, Garland, Elwood, Fielding, Portage, Washakie, Promontory, Penrose, Bothwell, Thatcher and Golden Spike Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 378 and 400. Interstate 84 between mile markers 17 and 42. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. Theis type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
